q: be planning to do will affect Rochester directly. Senator Kirsten Gillibrand really hopes to hear that the research and development tax credit will be made permanent. She said that could bring many jobs here to Rochester. What that tax credit is about is it allows businesses that are innovators, entrepreneurial businesses like a lot of the businesses in Rochester to invest in research in development and get a credit for that investment. So really it makes a difference in creating jobs, particularly in growing industries like high tech, bio-tech, energy technology, optical technology all of that work that we do in Rochester would really benefit greatly from an R&D tax credit that's permanent. As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated. So Larry Page , Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long Tim Cooke about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, Eric Schmidt said in a posting on the company's official blog.`` And over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured.''
